guide.introduction: This guide will share ideas for common materials you can use to create a one-of-a-kind remote-controlled car.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This guide will share ideas for common materials you can use to create a one-of-a-kind remote-controlled car.

Relevant parts
  • Electric drill, motor
  • Electric drill, throttle switch
  • Electric drill, battery pack
  • Zip ties
  • medical syringe
  • RC Transmitter
  • RC receiver
  • RC receiver battery
  • Servo
  • Vacuum belt
  • RC wheels
  • 1/2" PVC tubing
  • 1/2" PVC connectors
  • RC ON/OFF switch
  • Peg board
  • Syringe cap
  • RC wheel mount
  • RC axle
Tools
  • Oscillating table saw
  • Screwdriver, Flat head
  • Screwdriver, Phillips head
  • Soldering iron
  • Wire stripper/crimper
  • hand-held electric drill
  • jig saw
  • wire snips

steps.title: Remove drill motor and speed control

lines.text: Split electric drill in half.

lines.text: Remove electric drill motor and throttle switch assembly.

lines.text: Remove drill motor from casing and throttle switch from throttle body as shown.

lines.text: We recommend that you arrange the PVC connectors on the table to determine your chassis profile.  Here was our initial step.

lines.text: Mount upper and lower swing arms to RC wheel mount as shown.  Ensure movement of swing arms.

lines.text: Test wheel on suspension arms for clearance between chassis frame and ground.

lines.text: Use medical syringe with cap to create strut.

lines.text: Mount handle of syringe to chassis frame as shown.

lines.text: Repeat for all four wheel positions.

lines.text: Modify throttle switch by removing inner throttle button spring and replacing with lighter-duty outer spring as shown.  Use a washer and pin to keep outer spring in place.
lines.text_raw: Modify throttle switch by removing inner throttle button spring and replacing with lighter-duty outer spring as shown.  Use a washer and pin to keep outer spring in place.

lines.text: Next, drill a hole through the throttle button, through the throttle assembly and fish through fishing line as shown.
lines.text_raw: Next, drill a hole through the throttle button, through the throttle assembly and fish through fishing line as shown.

lines.text: Tie ends of fishing line to servo arms as shown.
lines.text_raw: Tie ends of fishing line to servo arms as shown.

lines.text: Use RC axles to connect rear wheels together.  Route the axles through a piece of PVC tubing with a hole to feed the vacuum belt through as shown.  Secure PVC tubing to chassis.
lines.text_raw: Use RC axles to connect rear wheels together.  Route the axles through a piece of PVC tubing with a hole to feed the vacuum belt through as shown.  Secure PVC tubing to chassis.

lines.text: Mount electric drill motor to chassis as shown.  Create a wooden drum with a shoulder to ensure that the vacuum belt stays in place.
lines.text_raw: Mount electric drill motor to chassis as shown.  Create a wooden drum with a shoulder to ensure that the vacuum belt stays in place.

lines.text: Mount servo to chassis as shown.  Create and mount steering servo connector piece as shown.  Connect steering arms to the connector piece as shown.
